page.title: 06ARTS AND CRAFTS
page.content: In matters artistic Uplawmoor is well represented.Jewellery designer Alison Welsh,whose designs use titanium and niobium(man-made metals developed by N.A.S.A.),is building up business successfully, having achieved the Design Centre Award. Originally a stained and engraved glass artist,Ralph Cowan is planning an autumn exhibition.His most important early commission was the engraved panels for the lounge and winter garden in the first Queen Elizabeth liner.Since his show in London,1967,he has developed his painting talents,holding 12 one-man exhibitions.Major clients include the Bank of Scotland,and Stirling and Strathclyde Universities. Embroidery commissions are accepted by Margaret Pollok.
